intro: Acipetalum, commonly known as the false holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its evergreen shrubs with dense, leathery leaves and small, clustered flowers. The flowers are typically white or pink and are often borne in terminal or axillary clusters. Acipetalum species are native to southern Africa and are adapted to rocky, well-drained soils. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
